wikipedia_page.main: William Hart McDonald Murdoch (born 21 April 1949) is a Scottish former professional footballer, who played across the country's three senior divisions for Stenhousemuir and Kilmarnock. His older brother is the late Bobby Murdoch, also a footballer and one of Celtic's most decorated players.

response: * Billy Murdoch (1854–1911), Australian cricket's greatest batsman of the 19th century
* Billy Murdoch (footballer) (born 1949), Scottish footballer for Stenhousemuir and Kilmarnock

Murdoch was born in Sandhurst (now Bendigo), Victoria, to Gilbert Murdoch and his wife Susanna (née Fleigge).Christopher Morris, 'Murdoch, William Lloyd (Billy) (1854–1911)', Australian Dictionary of Biography, Vol. 5, MUP, 1974, pp 314–315. Retrieved 25 October 2009. His father was an American of Scottish descent, who had been a corporal in the U.S. Army prior to emigrating from Maryland to Tasmania in 1849. He died shortly before his son's birth.Edward Liddle (9 September 2015). "Billy Murdoch – the first man to captain an Australian XI in Ireland" – Cricket Europe. Retrieved 10 September 2015. The family moved to New South Wales in the early 1860s. Both Billy Murdoch and his older brother, Gilbert, subsequently studied law at the University of Sydney. Billy Murdoch married Jemima Watson (1863–1917) daughter of John Boyd Watson on 8 December 1884 at the Free Church of England, Collingwood, Victoria, Australia.
